summary.about_our_company: Ecos (India) Mobility & Hospitality Limited is a leading provider of chauffeured car rentals (CCR) and employee transportation services (ETS) in India. They have been serving corporate customers, including Fortune 500 companies, for over 25 years. Ecos operates a fleet of over 9,000 vehicles ranging from economy to luxury cars, mini vans, and coaches. They are the largest and most profitable chauffeur-driven mobility provider in India based on revenue and profit after tax for Fiscal 2023.
summary.risk_factors: Investing in Ecos Equity Shares carries inherent risks. These include: dependence on certain industries and customers, particularly in the global capability centers (GCC), potential failure to meet stringent quality standards, competition from other mobility solutions, economic downturn impact, and legal and regulatory uncertainties.
summary.financial_information: Ecos' Restated Consolidated Financial Statements have been prepared in accordance with Ind AS and reflect adjustments for accounting policies, material errors, and reclassifications. They provide financial data for the six months ended September 30, 2023 and the Fiscals ended March 31, 2021, March 31, 2022, and March 31, 2023. Key financial performance indicators include revenue from operations, EBITDA, PAT margin, Return on Capital Employed, and Return on Equity.
summary.legal_and_other_information: Ecos has filed criminal complaints against former employees for alleged criminal breach of trust, cheating, fraud, and data theft. The company is also involved in ongoing civil litigation, but the material ones are nil. Ecos is in compliance with disclosure and accounting norms as specified by SEBI. Further, the company has disclosed information about outstanding litigation and material developments, including any disciplinary actions against promoters.
summary.offer_related_information: The Offer comprises an Offer for Sale by the Selling Shareholder. The Equity Shares are subject to provisions of the Companies Act, SEBI ICDR Regulations, SEBI Listing Regulations, SCRA, SCRR, Ecos Memorandum of Association and Articles of Association. The Offer Price will be determined by Ecos and the Selling Shareholders in consultation with the BRLMs. The Offer Price, Price Band, and minimum Bid Lot will be published in newspapers and made available on the Stock Exchanges' websites.
summary.other_information: Ecos has provided a list of material contracts and documents for inspection. These include the Offer Agreement, Registrar Agreement, Cash Escrow and Sponsor Bank(s) Agreement, Share Escrow Agreement, Syndicate Agreement, Underwriting Agreement, and various resolutions. Copies of these documents will be attached to the Red Herring Prospectus and available on Ecos' website.
